review: To be sincere, this Red Robin was a total epic disappointment.. I came in one night with my brother for dinner and it was like a complete ghost town. The whole decor of this restaurant made me feel like I was at Denny's, shame, fail, tacky!  Now the food, I ordered an avocado burger and woah! Where was the avocado?!? o_O there was just a bunch of shredded lettuce, flavorless burger.. I didn't finish it and who could I complain too? The waitress was MIA, I saw no other staff members around. I saw her till she brought the check, could have probably walked out without paying and they would have not noticed that is how dead it was... I wouldn't come back to this RR location!

I enjoy a good burger and I enjoy a good lettuced wrapped burger. This place had both. We usually stop by before hitting up the movie theater across the street at the commons. I always order the same thing, A1 peppercorn burger, lettuced wrapped and with a little bit of pink in the middle. Apparently they do not have a medium or temp button on their POS systems. It was a funny conversation with the waiter actually about how you cannot order something medium, you have to specify you want a little bit of pink, that is what they button says that they send to the kitchen.  The burgers always seem fresh, need a little more seasoning but that is what the super awesome seasoning salt is for on the table. The french fries are never ending and make sure yo ask for a side of camp fire sauce, quite possibly the best dipping sauce invented for fries.

I rarely do this, but I just to have rewrite my latest and not so pleasant experience here at RR.  This is my go-to place and I have been a valued customer for awhile, and I can't even count the number of times I've been here! As a disclaimer, this rewrite has nothing to do with the quality of the food, but the service alone.  Service in my book definitely makes or breaks it in terms of satisfying the customer even if the food could be really bad, customer service will outshadow that problem; however, in my situation the service made the food not taste as good. My issue is with the lack of service that my family and I received upon sitting down.  We were directed to the booth in the outer most corner of the restaurant where at first seemed fine as there were other restaurant goers.  Our waitress was very attentive at the beginning as we were still waiting for one more member of my party and gave us plenty of time for our last person to come and go over the menu.  By the time, the last member of our party came she seemed to have vanished all together as the entire back section of the restaurant was completely empty, and we were the only party in the back.  It became even more odd that our waitress' section was the very front of the restaurant of about maybe 4 tables as ours is in the way back - in my head, it did not just make sense even logistically to have her do one table in the back and 3-4 tables near the front.  She was so occupied with the tables upfront that she barely was around to get us more water, fries, and dipping - it was absolutely ridiculous as I was constantly waving my hands frantically just to have her see me!  What also seemed to bother me was how slow the food came out, we came at 8pm on Friday, and I even asked what time they closed (11pm).  At first, I was being optimistic in the respect that the kitchen is slowing down because they're about to close but 4 hours prior for the food to be slow? That's absolutely ridiculous! And I almost felt rushed as well because the other servers were going to the other empty tables around us wiping them down and refilling seasoning and ketchup - it was honestly such a weird experience.   I'm never sitting in the back ever again nor would I recommend it UNLESS there are other parties around you, if not you mind as well just go up to the kitchen yourself and refill your water, dipping, and fries.  I really do like RR, but if the service is gonna be like this, I might have to reconsider.

This is the best chain burger for me. My typical order: Whiskey Burger, steak fries with a side of honey mustard dip (for the fries). They always hit the spot. It's a great fall back if I just want an unassuming, great burger at a decent price. Did mention that their cherry coke is done with grenadine? The sweet potato fries are not bad either. Keep it up!

The automatic hand towel dispenser is Right in front of the door in the women's bathroom and really inconvenient. Be careful kids don't run into you while your getting them! Sweet potato fries are delicious and the onion ring tower is a cute idea.  The lunch rush can be a little crowded but overall a good time if you aren't in a hurry.

Red Robin... yuck! Sorry, had to do it.  Anyways, this Red Robin was terrible.  I went on  Sunday night and as soon as I walked in I could see the utter disappointment on the staff's face "Oh no, we have to work??" There were probably only 2 other customers inside.  It seems like the sunday night crew is used to doing nothing - they were great at it. I should have know it wasn't going to be a good meal at that point - aside from the staff, the place was FREEZING, which is something I've never complained about before and there was a weird musty smell when we walked in. We got seated and waited over 10mins to get our drink orders in.  We placed our food order when the drinks came (4 of us) and waited almost 40mins for dinner.  Shortly after dinner our check arrived  - quickest service of the night. I ordered a turkey burger and it was easily the worst turkey burger I ever had - lukewarm and no flavor.  I've had a turkey burger at other Red Robins and they were all fine. Drink and fry refills were impossible.  Aside from  that, the tables were really run down, some were chipped real bad and broken.  The restroom was disgusting with dirty floors and used paper towels all over the place. This place is poorly run and should be overhauled.  I've never had a bad Red Robin experience before coming here.  The best part of the night was leaving.

Red Robin is very good. I work close by so I often come to this location for lunch. The location is good, I have never seen it get too crowded no matter what time I come. They give you unlimited fries which is awesome. The burgers are dank, the service is good, and the staff is friendly.
A Red Robin with easy parking, both in and out, great service, and very good food for the price point. Paleo notes: Any of the burgers sans bun.

One of the closer burger chains in Calabasas, I went here to lunch with a couple of friends. I have been to their chain at the Topanga mall as well. They have a variety of different burgers. Their two best in my opinion have to be the Red Robin Gourmet cheeseburger which is garnished with crisp lettuce, fresh tomatoes, pickles, onions, mayo & Red's pickle relish. You choose your favorite cheese: Cheddar, American, Swiss, Bleu, Provolone or Pepper-Jack and their Red Tavern's double which is topped with melted American cheese, fresh lettuce, tomato and Red's Secret Tavern Sauce on a toasted sesame bun, all wrapped in foil to help contain all of this Tavern goodness. I went with the Tavern and it was ok. This was due to the fact it was a bit over grilled and could have spent less time. The fries were good, and I washed it down with an Ice T.  Service was ok, not great. It took more than average time to bring out our burgers and they spent more time refilling our drinks than bringing over the food. So it didn't help when our food arrived the burgers were over-grilled. If it wasn't for the length of time it took to get our food and the over-grilled burgers the fourth star would have been given.  Parking is a non issue. Their lot has plenty of space.

Good, but not great - we were on the tail end of a long travel day from NJ to CA so just wanted something quick. This particular location was unique in that it looked nothing like any Red Robin I had ever seen. Turns out it was formerly a Howard Johnson's.  My wife was able to get a gluten free roll for her Chicken Burger but I think a $1 up charge was a bit steep. The sandwich, however, was very good. I chose the Chophouse Burger which was excellent. Our only real complaint was the fact that the place was freezing.

Holycrap, this place reeks of mediocrity. The one saving grace (the second star) was our server. She was great. Our order took forever, and then it came out wrong. You could see the exasperation on or server's face when she realized the kitchen made us wait for ever for or dinner, and then it was made incorrectly. She apologized a lot, and brought us free sweet potato fries to make up for it (tasty!). The burgers were mediocre, and on the small side, looking not a thing like the pictures in the menu. I mention this because they were really disappointing. Seriously.  The endless streak fries were meh, and the whole experience just dragged on for ever and was a bit overpriced for the quality and (minuscule) quantity of food you get. I have our server  a decent tip though, because she did the best she could with what she had. My advice: get a better burger for less at the Stand on Canoga, or Islands (if you simply must have the busy, noisy family environment). (The Stand totally wins that one, btw--great food!).

Before anyone reads further... this review has 1 star NOT because of the food.  Food was 4 stars...  We took our family of 5 to Red Robin last night... Upon walking in, the hostess took us to the back of the restaurant where there was an ending soccer party group. The server said that was the only place she could sit us and that the party was in the process of leaving... We sat there with the notion that they were all exiting since they were all standing up and kids were RUNNING AND SCREAMING throughout the place...  For 40 mins, I watched kids throwing their shoes all over, running and screaming, throwing chairs down, jumping on booths and the tables, jumping on top of tables and hitting the ceiling, throwing their shoes at the ceiling, throwing shoes and touching their big screen plasma tv's, while the parents of all these children just sat there and MANAGEMENT NOT ONCE came over to stop the AWFUL AWFUL behaviors of these children... Isnt it a health issue when people arent in their shoes??? Isnt it a health issue when barefoot children are jumping on empty booth tables in their dirty barefeet? At what point should a manager step in and say, "Your party is distrubing other patrons in the establishment, can you please tame it down"... WE has several kids run up to our table and scream in our faces... It was absolutely ABSURD and I blame both the parents of these terribly behaved children and the management for not taking care of their other PAYING patrons in the establishment.  There is NO excuse what so ever for the types of behaviors going on there last night and no excuse management could ever make for allowing such disgusting things that went on in there to go on.... 5 stars would have gone to our server Juan, who I believe really tried hard to keep us happy and taken care of while we were there... He would be the only reason we would EVER go back, and I even notated that on my credit card receipt... Management should be absolutely ashamaed of themselves.

Will not go here again. The bathroom was pretty beat up. Soap dispenser didn't work, nor did the towel dispenser. Waitress seemed alright, but brought over dirty and wet dishes for our sides. Ordered a burger and it was pretty raw inside. She also forgot my sauce. Was grossed out sitting in the booth, and eating at this joint. It also took more then the usual amount of time to pay and get out of this eatery. This place used to be so much better, no idea what happened to it.
I love Red Robin.  The all you can eat fries are amazing.  Servers are always nice.

I had a really good time here and excellent service by our waiter Manuel. The chili cheeseburger was a winner and I hate chili cheese but that one was like wow! I will ask for Manuel from now on as my waiter because he kept checking up on us to make sure our refills were always full.

Killing time waiting for my car to get serviced.  Strolled into this establishment to kill a half hour and get some food.  Ordered a chicken sandwich.  It sucked, but I'll eat anything, so that is sort of OK.  Would give it one star for the food.  Give it an extra star for the entertainment.  One of the other patrons told some piece of trash that she was a horrible mom (She was screaming at her toddler).  The lady was spot on in her observation.  Anyway, Joan Crawford took the poor child out to the car and then came back in and started screaming at the observant lady.  It was like being at the Jerry Springer show.  Got to give em a star for that.

Burger chain so it's a meh. It was so dead on a Saturday and yet I felt the waitress kept forgetting about us. Our hostess kept coming over to take our drink order and would let us know she was coming. Very strange. Food was decent. Bottomless strawberry lemonades and fries. I got the bacon cheese burger. It was ok.

This place is okay; service was lacking.  It's got ample space to park and the restaurant is huge.  But the food is just mediocre.  We tried several appetizers and definitely won't be trying the chips and salsa with guacamole.  The guacamole was terrible; tasted like it was from a jar and so did the salsa.  Chips were kinda stale.  Chicken wings were good and their fries were excellent.  As for the rest of the food; it's okay and nothing really screams out on the menu that is different from any other restaurant.  But I do have to insist that the turkey burger is delicious.  If you need a quick fix this is the place to go.  Wish our waitress was a little more attentive.

What can I say . . . .  For lunch on a Monday I guess you can't really go wrong but just don't expect anything impressive.  Burger was ok, service better than expected and the atmosphere was very dull. Location off the 101 means a lot of passers-by so it is a little like a truck stop.

My kids and I enjoy going to this place sometimes. It's very close to my house and there's always plenty of free parking. The service is good for a chain burger joint. Usually our waiter is Jesus , he's very friendly and attentive. We love the bottomless lemonade with strawberries, YUM!!
The bbq chicken breast sandwich is great! So are the bottomless fries!

Service was right on. Its never too packed at this location either which is a plus. A few Tvs to watch as well. Place was clean and great locatrion Calabasas. Got the bbq chicken wrap was great not dry at all as i expected it to be and a lil salad the salad was ok.  My friends who were not on the diet got the burgers with the bottomless fries which were great and yes i had to steal a few.  Will be back again

I had a hamburger with the gluten free bun.  There was a dollar extra charge for the bun.  The bun was ok, kinda dry and dense and broke apart while eating. I'm new to this gluten free diet and most gluten free bake goods tend to be this way so guess this is no fault to R.R.   Over all, this R.R. was clean and service was good.

I cannot recommend Red Robin for Celiac -their menu clearly states that everything is prepared in the same area and cross contamination is very likely.  I did not try the gluten free bun as it would be toasted on the same grill as the other buns.  The menu is very unfriendly and when I asked the wait staff, they did not understand any of the concerns, even bringing a salad with croutons.   There are other Gourment Burger places within the vicinity that are far more gluten free friendly and knowledgable. Thumbs down for anyone with celiac or wheat intolerances

It was my first Red Robin restaurant visit. First, there was no welcoming when we arrived. The hostess without even a glance at us was putting menu books in order. Second, The restaurant was occupied no more than at a 40% of capacity. There were a lot of free tables and a lot of waiters and waitresses browsing around. But it took us 10 minutes to be seated. Then bartender came by and suggested to eat at the bar. He asked us to provide a form of ID. After I gave him my ID "United States Employment Authorization Card" he refused to take it as a proof of my age. He said that he takes only CA state ID and doesn't take passports, military cards or any other form of US government IDs. I didn't want to argue with him because I don't like to be served by incompetent people, who knows what would they do - spit in your drink or put fingers in your food; so I left. This was my first and last visit to Red Robin restaurant. I will definitely not recommend it to my friends.
Best burgers in town hands down! My fave, the banzai burger with garden burger substitute! Yum!

I had a bad experience at this Red Robin, but have had better experiences there in the past. I raised my review from 2 stars to 3 stars because Red Robin took the time to contact me and discuss the bad experience I had, and also sent a gift to apologize. My initial review was 2 stars for the following reasons: The bathroom was very dirty and gross and needed attention. Also the service was and awkward. They forgetting to give us needed and requested items, and we had to wait a long time before we received everything we ordered.  The food was Average, but have had better food there in the past.  They were very short staffed and it had negative impact on their service.

I love Red Robin. This RR is either on the brink of closing or remodel because it is beat. I have been on East Coast time so I ate a very early dinner and the restaurant was empty and should have been spotless but it showed its wear. The bathrooms in particular is pretty gross. The food was fine and dandy. THe seasonal pumpkin milkshake was muy delicious.  Service was pretty bad. The few tables that sat around us were pretty impatient with the staff but luckily I was in no hurry.

OK let's see here. We stopped on our way home from Yosemite.  Thought this was going to be a good place to eat.  Wow we were dead wrong. First the lady sat us down and then the waiting and waiting started. Our waitress we'll call her Ditzy.  It literally took her 15 min to find us. We were ready to order when she finally got to us. We did not want appetizers or any thing! We had to ask for napkins and refills.  Every time I looked up Ditzy there was talking to friends and not doing her job. It's really a easy job but she failed really bad tonight. I told the manager on duty and all he could say was I'll look into it. This place failed in every way possible. From Ditzy to the Management.  I will never ever come back here again. In the tip space we said "Slow Service = 20 cents" maybe she will take her job seriously next time.

They have gluten free buns, and a gluten free menu, which is good for my bf with Celiac Disease. However, they charge extra for that, which I find wrong. However, we had an amazing server who took that charge off, since she wasn't going to penalize my boyfriend for having a medical condition that required such an alteration. I had a chicken breast sandwich, since I don't eat red meat, and it was really good. My chocolate malt was pretty darn good, too.  I'd come here again, especially if we have the level of service we received.
The team did exactly what was expected by us during the dinner. Decent burgers with steak fries and accurate service.

The food tastes great. Onto the experience. I called and said I'll come in 20 minutes for a to go burger.  I came and the burger was ready. I paid. I sat down and ate from the to go box. The waitress offered me water even though I had a to go box. She was nice.  My experience was good.  There is a lot of value in coming here. They keep all their licenses for operating at the front. I am coming here again.  I gave the waitress a $10 tip. My burger with fries was about $7

This red robin is not so busy like other red robins in the sfv. I've gone there a couple of times and never had to wait for a table. Fairly quiet vs other RRs. Waiters are kind of attentive since its not so busy.

The food is alright.  Typical greasy chain restaurant menu, no surprises there (so that's why they lose a star).  That said, you know what kind of food they serve if you've seen any of their commercials.  What gives this place points is the service.  The staff at the Calabasas location are genuinely friendly and attentive.  Monica is an amazing waitress!

My bff and I have been to this Red Robin a few times as it's close to her place. I've always liked their burgers and their BOTTOMLESS FRIES, hello! This time around, I wasn't feeling as hungry and my friend suggested I get a kid's meal. I ordered a kid's Clucks and Fries (chicken tenders) and the portion size was perfect! Two pieces of crispy chicken tenders and fries with a side of their ranch dressing, SO GOOD! And the price at 5 bucks was perfect too!  We were here on a Friday night and it wasn't packed. Our server was a nice gal, very attentive, came around and checked on us, didn't push the bill on us too soon, refilled our fry basket at our request. Plenty of seating inside, booths are nice and comfy. They've got multiple TVs showing whatever game is on at that time. There's plenty of parking on both sides of the restaurant and easy to enter and exit the lots.   I really like this location, maybe a tad more than Topanga. Good comfort food and good service.

Red Robin is very middle-of-the-road, especially in this location. I'm not a huge fan of eating "gourmet" burgers (read: anything that doesn't come out of a greasy fast food wrapper) and so the food is good, but never exceptional. I sometimes get their chicken bruschetta sandwich, which often has some unpleasant gristle on it. It seems they are as fond of making it as I am of eating it.  I've tried a few other things lately. The mac and cheese is strangely pungent and not overly worthwhile. Their French onion soup is surprisingly palatable, if not a touch too salty. The salads are nothing to write home about.  For all my commentary about their food, the service here is generally pretty good, and the location sports an outdoor dining area, which is nice. This location will be closing in a few weeks, however, so if you are (bafflingly) a fan of their burgers or other fare, you'll have to hit up the location at the Topanga mall.

I got food poisoning at this RR from a burger.  The waiter kept asking me if I wanted my burger to be a little pink.  I asked for medium.  When I got it, the bun was soaked from juices, so you couldn't even pick it up and I was sick as a dog for 2 days after eating it.  I'm glad they are closing!

This was the last time we ate here. This Red Robin was here forever. I brought my kids here from the time they were in grade school. This last trip I brought my grandchildren. As always, they have a good children's' menu. My grandchildren love the cheeseburger (they actually eat the whole thing!) I love the salads and my wife the gourmet burgers. All done well. And the bottomless fries are not good for the waistline, but delish going down. Alas, they are closing their doors for the last time. We will miss our neighborhood Red Robin!!

Not sure what happened, this place was a nice spot to come grab a quick bite to eat and had been in that location for years.. But this Red Robin is now CLOSED.  Judging by the looks on the outside (no more sign and closed parking lot), and the sign in the window this place might be closed for good. If this changes, I'll update my post.

Awwww, man, a friend just told me that this Red Robin closed.  I was rather surprised to see I hadn't ever reviewed this particular location, but trust me when I say that we had many a family gathering there......... my parents, my brother and his family, and our family.  This makes me kinda sad, I have to say.  It's not about the food..... that was just average (although my parents and I always used to get their California Chicken sandwich and looked forward to it each time).......it's more about the memories, and this was a good gathering place for that.
The placed closed on 4/13/14... Sad because it was my favourite Red Robin location. Always had plenty of parking, very convenient to the freeway and the Commons, and the staff was always nice.
Sad, the last affordable happy hour in the gated world of Calabasas is now closed.  Could also be last bartender named Juan to work in the area...we will miss you.
